channel.title: Dan Friedman's Data Science Knowledge Base

item.title: cut() Method: Bin Values into Discrete Intervals
item.description: Learn how to bin values in Python with pandas using the cut() method and through simple examples
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: shift() Method: Shift Values in Column Up or Down
item.description: Utilize the shift() method for a pandas series to shift values in a column up or down. This is equivalent to LAG() or LEAD() window functions in SQL.
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Pandas rank() Method: Equivalent to ROW_NUMBER(), RANK(), DENSE_RANK() and NTILE() SQL Window Functions
item.description: Utilize the rank() method for pandas series - equivalent to ROW_NUMBER(), RANK(), DENSE_RANK() and NTILE() SQL window functions
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Self Join
item.description: Self join a table in python and pandas
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Command Line Basic Minesweeper
item.description: Medium Python algorithm prototype of a basic version of Minesweeper as a command line game
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Spearman's Correlation
item.description: Learn Spearman's correlation to measure the strength and direction of association between two numerical variables
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Pearson's Correlation
item.description: Learn Pearson's correlation to understand the linear relationship between two continuous numerical variables
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Correlation Does Not Imply Causation
item.description: Understand what is correlation in statistics and how to interpet this statistic
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Independent Samples t-tests
item.description: Simple example in Python using NumPy and SciPy to walk through steps of independent sample t-tests
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman

item.title: Dependent Samples t-tests
item.description: Simple example in Python using NumPy and SciPy to walk through steps of dependent samples t-tests
item.dc:creator: Dan Friedman
